pros: Being able to see kids and people enjoy the water
cons: Having to deal with patrons who don’t want to follow rules

pros: You can take classes for free

review_title: Good for first job after college
pros: Flexible work environment and wasn't micromanaged
cons: Pay is a shame, buildings are old, and no privacy. Everyone talks to everyone and gossip about students. It's toxic, and you will wish you picked another job. It was mentally draining and can take a toll on your outlook on working at an institution.

pros: People and work environment are great.

Some of the most generous, dedicated people I've ever worked with in 40 years, from trustees and president down through faculty and staff peers. Institution works hard to provide a good experience for students, particularly first-generation college students and underachievers, whom it's good at getting to blossom.
cons: Previous president cratered the finances. Alumni support sucks (16% participation even after a crisis? Really?). Even before the crisis the pay was about the lowest in the state for colleges of this type.
